verses.text: In the ninth year of Zedekiah king of Judah , in the tenth month , came Nebuchadrezzar king of Babylon and all his army against Jerusalem , and they besieged it.
\add And\add* in the eleventh year of Zedekiah , in the fourth month , the ninth \add day\add* of the month , the city was broken up.

And all the princes of the king of Babylon came in , and sat in the middle gate , \add even\add* Nergal-sharezer , Samgar-nebo , Sarsechim , Rab-saris , Nergal-sharezer , Rab-mag , with all the residue of the princes of the king of Babylon. \p

¶ And it came to pass, \add that\add* when Zedekiah the king of Judah saw them, and all the men of war , then they fled , and went forth out of the city by night , by the way of the king’s garden , by the gate betwixt the two walls : and he went out the way of the plain.

But the Chaldeans’ army pursued after them, and overtook Zedekiah in the plains of Jericho : and when they had taken him, they brought him up to Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon to Riblah in the land of Hamath , where he gave judgment upon him.\f + \fr 39.5 \ft gave…: Heb. spake with him judgments\f*
Then the king of Babylon slew the sons of Zedekiah in Riblah before his eyes : also the king of Babylon slew all the nobles of Judah.
Moreover he put out Zedekiah’s eyes , and bound him with chains , to carry him to Babylon.\f + \fr 39.7 \ft with…: Heb. with two brasen chains, or, fetters\f* \p
¶ And the Chaldeans burned the king’s house , and the houses of the people , with fire , and brake down the walls of Jerusalem.

Then Nebuzar-adan the captain of the guard carried away captive into Babylon the remnant of the people that remained in the city , and those that fell away , that fell to him, with the rest of the people that remained.\f + \fr 39.9 \ft captain…: or, chief marshal: Heb. chief of the executioners, or, slaughtermen\f*

But Nebuzar-adan the captain of the guard left of the poor of the people , which had nothing , in the land of Judah , and gave them vineyards and fields at the same time.\f + \fr 39.10 \ft captain…: or, chief marshal: Heb. chief of the executioners, or, slaughtermen\f*\f + \fr 39.10 \ft at the…: Heb. in that day\f* \p

¶ Now Nebuchadrezzar king of Babylon gave charge concerning Jeremiah to Nebuzar-adan the captain of the guard , saying ,\f + \fr 39.11 \ft to: Heb. by the hand of\f*\f + \fr 39.11 \ft captain…: or, chief marshal: Heb. chief of the executioners, or, slaughtermen\f*
Take him, and look well to him, and do him no harm ; but do unto him even as he shall say unto thee.\f + \fr 39.12 \ft look…: Heb. set thine eyes upon him\f*

So Nebuzar-adan the captain of the guard sent , and Nebushasban , Rab-saris , and Nergal-sharezer , Rab-mag , and all the king of Babylon’s princes ;\f + \fr 39.13 \ft captain…: or, chief marshal: Heb. chief of the executioners, or, slaughtermen\f*

Even they sent , and took Jeremiah out of the court of the prison , and committed him unto Gedaliah the son of Ahikam the son of Shaphan , that he should carry him home : so he dwelt among the people. \p
¶ Now the word of the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* came unto Jeremiah , while he was shut up in the court of the prison , saying ,

Go and speak to Ebed-melech the Ethiopian , saying , Thus saith the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* of hosts , the God of Israel ; Behold, I will bring my words upon this city for evil , and not for good ; and they shall be \add accomplished\add* in that day before thee.
But I will deliver thee in that day , saith the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*: and thou shalt not be given into the hand of the men of whom thou \add art\add* afraid.

For I will surely deliver thee, and thou shalt not fall by the sword , but thy life shall be for a prey unto thee: because thou hast put thy trust in me, saith the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*.
